title: Bick Campbell
text:
William Michael "Bick" Campbell (May 1, 1898 – September 27, 1961) was an American professional <a href="baseball">baseball</a> <a href="umpire%20%28baseball%29">umpire</a> who worked in the <a href="American%20League">American League</a> from 1928 to 1931 and in the <a href="National%20League">National League</a> in 1939 and 1940. Campbell umpired 936 <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">major league</a> games in his seven-year career.
Campbell died of pneumonia on September 27, 1961, in <a href="Detroit">Detroit, Michigan</a>. His son, <a href="Mike%20Campbell%20%28American%20football%29">Mike Campbell</a>, was a college football coach.
